normalized: once, mars had been full of greenery.
mars, where the terra-forming had been undertaken earliest, was at an advanced stage,
and had become famous for being the last paradise in the universe, with an abundant supply of essential food products, valuable natural resources and a healthy living environment for humanity.

however, a severe conflict had erupted between the two opposing factions within the universal federation, the neo-terras and the new-solars, giving rise to a civil war between the various martian city-states.
the violent outbreak of this civil war had led to the destruction of the terra-forming plant and culminated with the formerly green planet being converted into a quagmire.
due to the rampaging global system, a vast sea had formed on the martian surface.
the sand sea.
it was a sea consisting of a special type of sand ― which was composed of miniscule sand granules with the properties of water.
all the sea-water had converted into this sand,
which had led to a dramatic shift in the leadership powers on mars.
beatrice kushan.
she was the perpetrator directly responsible for the destruction of the terra-forming plant on mars.
beatrice kushan, who at the time had been the commander of the martian army of the neo-terras, defected with the neo-terras under her direct control.
she named them the mars civic liberation armed forces, in short, “kushan armed forces”, and began waging war on all the martian city-states.

each power that was unable to adapt to the new environment of the “sand sea” was overthrown, one after another, by the powerful “kushan armed forces”, who had successfully recalibrated their equipment beforehand to suit that environment.
80% of mars came under the control of beatrice kushan, and she came to be feared as “the empress”.
perseus city.
this was the second largest city-state on mars, with a population of approximately 8 million.
it was a kushan military stronghold.
a small port-town, named cyrus, rested on the outskirts of this city-state.
a sharp voice echoed from within a certain mansion of that town.

name: beatrice
normalized: so, now the insect thinks that peace is a viable prospect, huh?
it was a woman.
the woman known as the empress, beatrice kushan.
this extravagant mansion, where she now resided, had once belonged to a wealthy businessman hailing from perseus city.
it was requisitioned to her, after the former ruler of the city-state made an open-city declaration, and had become the official residential mansion of the empress ever since.
that step had supposedly been taken to win the confidence of the kushan armed forces, by swearing loyalty to her and her alone.
the empress, beatrice, was peering sharply at the man who stood in front of her.
he was a messenger of the neo-terras.
the man, who was unable to stop sweating despite being in the air-conditioned living-room of the luxurious mansion, was captain thomas mahoi.
he was a representative of general william ahle moller, the chief of the space federal operations and one of the “four elders” ― the highest leadership of the neo-terras.

name: mahoi
normalized: umm… w-well, t-that is why general moller has…

name: beatrice
normalized: general moller?
beatrice, who was overflowing with beauty accompanied with her strong intellect and spirit, shot a sharp glance at the messenger which pierced right through his heart.

all the while licking the rim of her glass which was filled with red martian wine made of farm plants, which had been harvested in large scale underground facilities on account of the ecological changes.
mahoi wiped the sweat dripping down off his forehead, as if she had compelled him to do so, and continued talking.

name: mahoi
normalized: a-anyway, general moller highly appreciates your excellency’s capabilities…

name: mahoi
normalized: the past is water under a bridge… for now, the alliance of earth and mars would be beneficial for all concerned…

name: mahoi
normalized: especially, when it comes to the ordering of the impending new universe.

name: beatrice
normalized: save it.
i have heard that story before, captain.
beatrice kushan interrupted the messenger’s long-winded introduction with a pointed response of her own.

name: beatrice
normalized: do you think i enjoy listening to your babble?
as she sharply glared at mahoi, he revealed his unease and…

name: mahoi
normalized: oh yes!
e-excuse me, what i really meant to say was that, a-as proof of your allegiance to our neo-terras, general moller will take control of,

name: mahoi
normalized: c-colony no.
27, 『kansas』, and colony no.
103, 『kelowna』, whenever you made cede them…

name: beatrice
normalized: hmm
a slight change came upon the expression on the empress’s face.
it seemed like she was reading the whole situation for what it really was.

name: beatrice
normalized: is that the will of the “four elders”?

name: mahoi
normalized: of course!

name: beatrice
normalized: heh
a sarcastic smile appeared on the edges of her scarlet lips.

name: beatrice
normalized: you seem to have become extremely pitiable, having been cut off from the strategic supplies of mars under the leadership of those old-aged insects.

name: mahoi
normalized: w-well yes!
it isn’t… good… for the people of earth.
they have all become gravely impoverish, having lost the supplies from mars.

name: mahoi
normalized: p-please give this matter special consideration from a humanitarian standpoint――
the expression on beatrice’s face changed silently,
into an icy-cold one.
and with that, mahoi’s ceaseless babbling came to an abrupt halt.

name: beatrice
normalized: captain…

name: mahoi
normalized: y-yes…!?
due to the change in the empress’s expression, mahoi almost fell to the ground and began to retreat.
he had heard a lot about her “legend”.

the skew-tam city armed forces had been vehemently resisting the kushan armed forces and had cruelly slaughtered beatrice’s messenger, who had been sent to them to negotiate the terms of their surrender.

beatrice besieged their entire city by completely surrounding it, denied all negotiations thereafter, and declared that all its military forces as well as its civilians, which accounted for more than 120,00 people, would starve to death.
as withered corpses, comprised only of skin and bones, rolled through the city, the remaining survivors murdered each other for mere scraps of food.
it was the very personification of hell brought to life.
soon thereafter, the beautiful female chief of lacerta city, “joan of arc of mars”, yuria baltzer, failed in her assassination attempt on beatrice, and was captured.
beatrice hunted down yuria’s entire family, from her husband to even her infant children,
and, one by one, carried out their brutal and excruciatingly torturous drawn-out public executions in front of yuria’s very eyes.

it was rumoured that all of yuria’s teeth had been pulled out so that she would be unable to bite her tongue off, all her limbs had been torn off and she had been kept alive for an entire week despite bleeding profusely.
the bloody legend of beatrice flashed through mahoi’s mind,
and at the same time, he was enthralled by her.
she looked like the very personification of death adorned with beauty to his eyes.
indeed, beatrice kushan was a witch.

name: beatrice
normalized: problems created by old senile leaders are ludicrous.
the witch set her glass of wine down and approached mahoi all of a sudden.

name: mahoi
normalized: w-wha…!?

name: beatrice
normalized: do you know, captain?

name: beatrice
normalized: when my home-nation opposed the national union of earth, the four superpowers launched thermo-nuclear weapons which led to it being wiped off the face of the earth,

name: beatrice
normalized: along with 3 million innocent people.
our kushan armed forces is a group of these exiles.

name: mahoi
normalized: oh… oh, that is… in the past.
that was unfortunate…
beatrice smirked as mahoi panicked and attempted to gloss it over.

name: beatrice
normalized: don’t misunderstand me, captain.
i am not one to hold such grudges.

name: beatrice
normalized: i am grateful to the four ex-superpowers, now known as the “four elders”.

name: beatrice
normalized: how to attain power?
how to exercise that power?
i learnt it all from them.
she was smiling, similar to how a witch smiles before gleefully offering a ritual sacrifice.

name: mahoi
normalized: let me extend my apologies to you, m-miss kushan, your excellency.
i…
bravely or rather recklessly, mahoi tried to keep the conversation going as a messenger.

name: beatrice
normalized: captain♪

name: mahoi
normalized: y-yes!?

name: beatrice
normalized: this is an unprecedented situation.

name: mahoi
normalized: yes!
y-yes, it is!

name: beatrice
normalized: captain♪

name: beatrice
normalized: the spacecraft arsenal of kansas is especially valuable.
she pressed her white supple finger on the chin of the trembling messenger.
her finger was beautiful and didn’t suit someone known as the empress at all.

name: mahoi
normalized: hii…?

name: beatrice
normalized: however, isn’t this an extremely insignificant life, to bring forth such a significant proposal?

name: mahoi
normalized: w-what do you mean…?

name: beatrice
normalized: captain, you, who have brought forth such a proposal which would sway the very balance of the universe, i am saying your life is worthless.
the eyes of the empress were glaring fiercely.
mahoi cried out loudly, barely managing to hold onto his shaky reason which was near collapse.

name: mahoi
normalized: i-if i d-die here then you will l-lose all c-credibility with our g-g-g-general!

name: mahoi
normalized: a-a-and, i have been requested to convey this to you, a-as the official messenger of the general himself!

name: mahoi
normalized: he will be arriving here soon!

name: beatrice
normalized: ooh?
have those wary old men finally decided to crawl out of the earth?

name: mahoi
normalized: t-the place of n-negotiation is the neutral city of libra!
no party is to bring a fleet.

name: mahoi
normalized: the neutral ships from libra are to be used to enter libra city, where the meeting will be held!

name: beatrice
normalized: hmm.
you have my curiosity now, captain.
very well.
the empress slipped her finger away from mahoi’s neck.

name: mahoi
normalized: t-thank you very much!

name: beatrice
normalized: moreover, i have heard of the old man’s intention from my “network”.
i believe you, captain.

name: mahoi
normalized: t-thank you!
thank you very much!
mahoi gave his thanks while shedding tears of relief.
he was completely assured that it was unlikely for him to be killed now, no matter what happened.

name: beatrice
normalized: go home and tell the old man that i will meet him.

name: mahoi
normalized: y-yes!
yes!
mahoi dropped his guard in relief.
the empress told him with a cold-blooded smile.

name: beatrice
normalized: well then, that’s that――

name: mahoi
normalized: y-yes!

name: beatrice
normalized: although, do you think it is worth you being allowed to live?

name: mahoi
normalized: huh?
his unusually active tongue suddenly froze.
his entire body started trembling and he lowered his head.
he had become petrified with fear and was unable to look up at beatrice’s face.

name: beatrice
normalized: fufu
the empress licked her lustrous lips seductively,
and she smacked mahoi across his abdomen with the crop, which she had in her hand.

name: mahoi
normalized: ooh!
guuh!?
it was a heavy blow, nothing like the smack of a usual crop.
mahoi kneeled on the spot in agony.

name: mahoi
normalized: uuh… uguguguh…

name: beatrice
normalized: raise your face.

name: mahoi
normalized: w-what is wrong…?
why did you…?

name: beatrice
normalized: i said, raise your face.
beatrice pressed the crop on the scruff of the crouched messenger’s neck.

name: mahoi
normalized: hngh… y-yes.
mahoi let out a groan from his slobbering mouth, before looking up at beatrice with his tearful face.

name: beatrice
normalized: you are a terrible coward, captain.

name: mahoi
normalized: w-w-what!?

name: beatrice
normalized: it seems like you can’t resist being my enemy, can you?

name: mahoi
normalized: d-dat’sh right… kuuh…!
i mean, if dat ish whad you wand!
inadvertently, mahoi ended up reaffirming the words of the empress, while not understanding why she had suddenly resorted to violence.

name: beatrice
normalized: in the end, you are nothing but a weakling.

name: mahoi
normalized: y-yes!
mahoi nodded like an idiot.
beatrice looked at him with disgust, as if she was looking at an insect.
and then, another person came forth.

name: girl
normalized: mother, i am back.
she was a dark-brown beauty.
her face was very similar to that of beatrice.
she had the features of a beautiful witch as well, and a figure which couldn’t help but enthral a man.
nevertheless, it was apparent that she, too, possessed a soul that could pierce through anyone.
she was the daughter of the empress, an ace pilot and the lieutenant commanding the sand sea armoured cavalry unit, “the grim reaper of the sands”, kila kushan.

name: beatrice
normalized: you are early, kila.
the mother gazed at her daughter in satisfaction.
kila nodded matter-of-factly and said,

name: kila
normalized: mother, we have “recovered” the five wiretaps with highly confidential communication transmissions, as well as the names of three covert operatives.
having said so, she threw something at mahoi, who was staring at her utterly dumbfounded.

name: mahoi
normalized: heh, higiih!?
it was an ear.
the ear struck him, which was still dripping warm blood.

name: kila
normalized: this is moller’s dog.
a weakling.
just like her mother, kila looked down on mahoi with disparaging eyes.

name: beatrice
normalized: however, this wasn’t that man’s doing, it was his.
therefore, he is mistaken if he thinks his own transgressions will be allowed to pass.

name: kila
normalized: are these guys trying to earn credits?
or do you think they have stopped “playing” for the old man?
kila took out her mobile device while floating a cruel smile.
a voice began to echo from it.

name: mahoi
normalized: haa!?
mahoi’s face had become entrenched in fear by now.
it was a conversation between him and general moller.
mahoi had applied for general moller’s work.
if he was exposed and the negotiations collapsed, general moller was to refute all claims against him and dismiss the contents concerning their liaison.

name: beatrice
normalized: the confidential communication of the neo-terras has been decoded, captain.
mahoi had given the go-ahead to his spy without the approval of his senior officer.
the ear belonged to that spy.

name: mahoi
normalized: kuh… hii!
the frightened face of the messenger distorted and a look of conceit came upon his face in its stead.
he grabbed the wine bottle placed on the low table, smashed it and tried to point its sharp edge towards kila.
even though the witch’s blood didn’t apparently flow through this girl, she would still regret losing her daughter.
it wouldn’t be too difficult for him to escape from this complicated situation with the assistance of his special forces, especially while holding her daughter hostage.
moreover, if he brought her daughter back, he could absolve himself of his failure, having acted on his own judgement.
he thought of such things.

name: mahoi
normalized: don’t move!
mahoi swore fiercely.
but then, he saw his own body as if his head tumbling down.

name: mahoi
normalized: eh…?
both of mahoi’s eyes peeled back into his head without him even realizing what had happened.
he was already dead.

name: kila
normalized: useless dog.
a flash of kila’s combat-knife had cleaved through his neck at such a speed, that he had been unable to even perceive it.
there wasn’t a single drop of blood stuck to it.

name: kila
normalized: what do you want to do, mother?
kila sheathed her combat-knife as if nothing had happened.

name: beatrice
normalized: let us see what the old man is up to at this meeting.

name: kila
normalized: alright.
well then, i will look into it diligently and, meanwhile, dispatch a message of when we are to accept their negotiations.
kila looked at the head of the man, that she had just decapitated, cheerfully.
beatrice looked at it as well.

name: beatrice
normalized: i appreciate your efforts.
the empress tilted her glass and offered the remaining red wine to the wretched corpse of the dead man as tribute.
